intro: Idothearia humilis, commonly known as the small white bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10-20 centimeters. The plant features small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded woodland areas. Idothearia humilis is native to parts of Europe and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
